content: **snowman worry worm crochet pattern** are you looking for a small snowman to crochet one that s a quick make and has the added benefit of helping to relieve stress anxiety & depression meet winston the snowman snuggler he s your tiny christmas friend that ll be more than happy to take away any worries you may have this time of the year just hold him tight twirl him around with your fingers and feel the stress melt away you can use this little snowman worry worms as - stocking stuffers for kids - christmas tree decor - calming tools in classrooms - nursing home giveaways or - you could hide them out & about for people to find during the festive season i ve designed some cute little tags for you to include with your worry worm act of kindness **materials needed** - cotton yarn in white black red & orange either lang handarbeitsgarn 12 wpi 100% cotton 1 ricorumi dk 100% cotton 25 g 57 5 m 2 or lily s sugar & cream from lovecrafts 3 - crochet hook size e 4 5 mm 4 - trimits toy eyes solid black 6mm 5 goggly eyes 6 or black fiber art beads 7 or a permanent marker see 15 worry worm eye options to choose from 8 - fluffy cotton filling 9 fiberfill or a few strands of leftover yarn - plastic or organza baggies 10 - printer & a4 paper to print your tags you could choose to print your tags on cardstock to make them more durable - stitch markers 11 or a piece of contrasting color yarn optional - a tapestry needle 12 - a pair of scissors snowman tags i also designed some cute snowman tags to go along with this snowman worry worm they can be purchased separately from my website here 13 **abbreviations** mc = magic_ring chain = chain single_crochet = single_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet slip_stitch = slip_stitch st = stitch sts = stitches decrease = single_crochet decrease fo = fasten_off **skill level** intermediate knowledge of how to crochet a magic_ring is ideal if you don t know how to start with a mc then simply start with a chain 2 then work r 1 into the second chain from your hook **gauge** 14 stitches and 8 row = 10 cm in double_crochet if your worry worm looks narrow or not as full as you anticipated try a heavier weight yarn if you want your worry worm to be longer or shorter just increase/decrease the number of stitches in your body chain **size** this snowman worry worm measures approx 5 5 14 cm in height including the hat **yardage** weight approximately 9 g yardage approximately 15 yards **notes** - you can use any type of yarn as long as you have a corresponding crochet hook size check yarn label for recommendations - you can make the pattern larger or smaller by changing the type of yarn and/or hook size -
